item.title: Getting YouCompleteMe working for kernel development
item.description: YCM is a pretty neat tool for speedy kernel development in vim. Especially when you don’t want to write a whole bunch of code, and then deal with 100s of compiler errors. It is better to fix the errors on the spot, as you write the code. That’s exactly what YCM is best at since it constantly builds the code on the fly. The other great thing about it among other things being, it will show you function prototypes and so forth as you type, so you can call functions correctly with the right set of parameters and types.
